name: Monster Anthology Bundle
description: The Monster Anthology Bundle brings all of Red Stylo's graphic anthologies together for the first time! In addition to Poe Twisted and Shakespeare Shaken, buyers will also get the limited "Monster Edition" of our newest collection, Unfashioned Creatures: A Frankenstein Anthology. All three anthologies are available in this special set for only $50! Three trade paperbacks, full color

name: Pair of Shakespeare Shakers
description: Shakespeare Shakers Pack features both the titular anthology and a "Ophelia's Revenge," a beautiful 12"x18" full color print from artist Laura Guzzo for only $25! SHAKESPEARE SHAKEN is a comic anthology of original graphic works (including short comic stories, short series and vignettes) inspired by the plays, poetry and life of William Shakespeare. The folio features work from over thirty comic artists and writers. Full-color trade paperback with over 200 pages.

name: Super Twisted Poe Cask Pack!
description: This pack is for the fan who can't get enough Poe or The Cask of Amontillado, the macabre story of ultimate revenge by Edgar Allan Poe. This haunting and sinister illustrated work is by artist Jason Strutz, adapted for the comic page by writer Enrica Jang. This 24-page full color comic is the perfect way to prep for the release of House of Montresor, a full-length graphic novel by the same creative team, and a sequel to Poe's Cask of Amontillado, expanding and continuing the tale of murder and vendetta that the villainous Montresor only hints at, fifty years after committing the "perfect" crime. Also in this bundle is the Poe Twisted Anthology, a collection of original comics inspired by Edgar Allan Poe! Full color trade paperback, and 96 pages of scary gothic fun.

name: Poe Twisted and a Poe-ster
description: "Take the characters or setting from your favorite Edgar Allan Poe story, twist them, and make something new." The Poe Twisted Anthology is a challenge to a new crop of artists and writers to be inspired by Poe, rather than simply retell him. Clever, haunting, and with an eclectic mix of styles and genres, this collection of original comics is a graphic tribute to the dark master of American Gothic fiction. Created by Poe fans, for Poe lovers everywhere. Full color, trade paperback, 90-pages "The Beating of the Hideous Cuteness" is a vignette by artist Jason Strutz. It features the crazed figure of Poe in mid-strike as he tries to cobble cuteness and light safely away and out of sight under the floorboards. (It was the unicorn that threw you, right? Yeah, us too.) The print is a full color poster, 12 x 18.

name: Sci Fi Pack!
description: Get two great new sci-fi titles in this pack! Torchbearer combines corporate espionage with science fiction, asking the question: What would you do when corporations start buying up planets, star systems, entire galaxies? This trade collects Issues 1 through 3 in this new series from writer Nicholas Dedual and artist Dennis Calero! Drago Bentley: Space Detective is a sci-fi crime tech-noir story about a gifted Private Detective, Drago Bentley. Drago is made blind when his optical implants are switched off and is forced to reanimate a hated-android as “seeing eye dog” to solve the case of a missing billionaire, and in the process expose the truth behind a militant group of high level androids and a corrupt senator hell-bent on controlling the world. Based on a feature script by Australian writer Joseph Kisch, and illustrated by artist Dave Acosta, the first eight issues of this sci-fi comic book is bound in a 254-page full color graphic novel, available for the first time in the United States right here! Full color, trade paperbacks

categories.name: Drago Bentley: Space Detective (Idiot's Lantern/Red Stylo)

name: City of Walls #2 (digital edition)
description: A plan comes together for the kids, as painful memories and pressure from their parents come into play. They have a place in mind...California. But where does Ariana fit into all this? Can Daniel's story inspire a stronger side of her than she knew existed? City of Walls, Book 2 is here, in full color! *** Kowloon City, the great walled oasis in Asia, cut off from the rest of the world. It is its own sovereign nation, and the word of the Triads is law. Life in Kowloon is not easy for anyone, especially Daniel Jin and Ariana. And though these three best friends may be from different backgrounds, soon they must come together in a common purpose: escape! Now re-mastered and in FULL COLOR, City of Walls is a new series by creators Shaun Noel and Abede Lovelace, with inks by Mark Morales. Published by Standalone Productions in cooperation with Red Stylo Press. 28 pages, PDF

name: Donate for Wounded Warriors, get $10 off at Red Stylo!
description: Coupon Code for $10 off in the Red Stylo Media store when you donate $50 to the Wounded Warrior Project. We will make the full $50 donation in your name and send you the receipt for tax purposes. We add $1 for shipping to help recover PayPal fees. (Add this to your shopping cart and complete the purchase--you will then receive an email with your discount code for the next purchase.) If you prefer to donate directly to Wounded Warriors, you can visit their site here: WoundedWarriorProject.org Email a copy of your $50 donation receipt via our "Contact" link at left and we will email your code in our reply.

name: TORCHBEARER #5
description:
With the civilians of Nova Amazonia rescued, and Cayoti’s chance of recovery dwindling with each passing month, the Torchbearers resume their operations. Their next mission: neutralize Prometheus’ new research project. No matter who or what gets in their way. 

- - - - - - - 

Corporate espionage meets science fiction. What would you do when corporations start buying up planets, star systems, entire galaxies?

Prometheus, Inc. is one of those corporations. For hundreds of years, they've served as a shining example of how corporations can bring peace and prosperity to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. But it's all been a front. They've been amassing power and resources, biding their time to take over.

And the time is now.

Writer: Nicholas Dedual
Artist: Michael Montenat
Full color, PDF digital download

name: TORCHBEARER (trade paperback)
description:
Collecting Issues 1 through 3 in this new series from writer Nicholas Dedual and artist Dennis Calero!

Corporate espionage meets science fiction. What would you do when corporations start buying up planets, star systems, entire galaxies?

Prometheus, Inc. is one of those corporations. For hundreds of years, they've served as a shining example of how corporations can bring peace and prosperity to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. But it's all been a front. They've been amassing power and resources, biding their time to take over.

And the time is now.

Full color, print trade paperback

name: Donate for Disaster Relief, get $10 off from Red Stylo!
description: Coupon Code for $10 off in the Red Stylo Media store when you donate $50 to the American Red Cross. We will make the full $50 donation in your name and send you the receipt for tax purposes. We add $1 for shipping to help recover PayPal fees. (Add this to your shopping cart and complete the purchase--you will then receive an email with your discount code for the next purchase.) If you prefer to donate directly to the Red Cross, you can visit their site here: redcross.org Email a copy of your donation receipt via our "Contact" link at left and we will email your code in our reply.

name: SMOOSHENSTEIN! (A Halloween BONUS from Unfashioned Creatures!)
description: A final bit of fun from Unfashioned Creatures, a Frankenstein Anthology! This 3-page mini was created by Marvel alum and indie creative, Damien Lucchese, with partner-in-art crimes Maritsa Patrinos. This Bonus story is featured in the Monster Edition of Unfashioned Creatures, a Frankenstein Anthology!

name: The Monster Demands a Mate (Unfashioned Creatures BONUS series)
description: The dating scene is tough...especially for shambling, patchwork monstrosities. When Adam enlists the help of his father to build him the perfect woman, he learns the hard lesson that parents (even mad scientists) just don't understand. "The Monster Demands a Mate" details the horrors of dating, father/son talks, and that one friend with the really disturbing taste in women, all courtesy of Josh Hechinger and Dan Betro. "The Monster Demands a Mate" is an BONUS mini-series featured in the collected Unfashioned Creatures, a Frankenstein Anthology! Josh Hechinger is a Cancer who enjoys long walks, sandos, and really dire puns. He made his comics debut in Image’s Comic Book Tattoo anthology, and his graphic novel debut with The Grave Doug Freshley from Archaia. He lives $9.50 away from Philly. http://roplusmo.com Daniel Betro a.k.a. MC Wolfman, is a hairy guy who draws stuff, was raised on pizza and cartoons on the mean streets of Poughkeepsie, NY. He took his love for doodling and turned it into a BFA in doodling at Columbus College of Art and Design. Currently hiding in a hole in Columbus, OH, doing freelance Illustration and Comics. Check out his work at MC-Wolfman.com

name: Monsters and the Monsters Who Make Them (Unfashioned Creatures)
description: Is the Monster responsible for his crimes, or simply a victim of poor parenting? Magistrate Kirwin seeks to answer this age-old question once and for all--by bringing all the characters on a sleazy talk-show! Trash-talk! Ghosts! Vulgarity! All this, after a word from our sponsors! Frankenstein and daytime-talk collide, courtesy of James McGee and Aex Cormack. "Monsters and the Monsters Who Make Them" is one of two comic mini-series in Unfashioned Creatures. James McGee has loved stories all his life, and has wanted to tell them since he was in the 8th grade. His work has been featured in Shakespeare Shaken, Super Flash Fiction, This Mutant Life, and Fireside Magazine. James lives in West Virginia with his wife, Laura, and an ever-growing army of cats. Visit him at http://jamesleemcgee.blogspot.com/ For a brief moment in 1982, Alex Cormack was the youngest human being on Earth. Now he is an illustrator/animator living in Waltham MA. His work has been seen in such publications as The Poe Twisted Anthology, Azteca, The Chikara Web Comic, The Minimum Paige Anthology, Hellbound 2 Anthology, Image Comics’s Skull-kickers, and the upcoming Oxymoron Anthology from Comix Tribe. He is also getting married to the world famous artist, Ashley Cook, who helped color The Hamelin Murders and the short Dead Men’s Story. Mr. Cormack encourages everyone to look up his website for more information, www.AlexCormack.com

name: Unbelonging (Unfashioned Creatures)
description: "Was I, then a monster, a blot upon the earth, from which all men fled and whom all men disowned." Mary Shelley, Frankenstein. Something is in the woods. Something that both man and animal fears. When two hunters discover this startling creature, will it be terror or pity that moves them? Anthony Moretta and Sarah Stern bring you "The Unbelonging," a tale of loneliness and isolation. The digital download includes pages from “The Monster Demands a Mate,” mini-series by Josh Hechinger, with art by Dan Betro. UNFASHIONED CREATURES is a collection of over twenty monstrous, moving and mirthful tributes to Mary Shelley and her legendary tale, Frankenstein. A host of creators have sewn together comic shorts, short-series and original artwork sure to inspire equal parts terror and wonder.

name: The Fire Thief (Unfashioned Creatures)
description: Myth says that Prometheus was sentenced to eternal suffering for stealing fire from the gods. A Monster--created by a man who also defied God's will--sets out to find the truth behind the legend. Along the way, he may also find peace in his own, unending existence. Frankenstein's Creature finally finds his purpose in "The Fire Theif" by S.J. Hock and Xander Kent. The digital download includes a page from “The Monster Demands a Mate,” a mini-series by Josh Hechinger, with art by Dan Betro. S.J. Hock tells stories in any medium he can get his mitts on. He got a BA in Cinema from San Francisco State and writes a webcomic called The Historically Accurate Adventures of Jack & Voytek, which you can read at CommandoBear.com. Xander Kent is an independent artist, specializing in illustration & graphic design. Having also earned his degree from SFSU, he has started a webcomic & media production house, We Doomed . Under this banner he collaborates Jackson & Sam Hock to produce two weekly webcomics, 6th Circle & The Historically Accurate Adventures of Jack & Voytek, respectively. His work has been seen in The San Francisco Chronicle, and has been published in the Halo: Evolutions Anthology Vol. 1 by Tor Books. View his cave-paintings here – RedGrimRune.com UNFASHIONED CREATURES is a collection of over twenty monstrous, moving and mirthful tributes to Mary Shelley and her legendary tale, Frankenstein. A host of creators have sewn together comic shorts, short-series and original artwork sure to inspire equal parts terror and wonder.

name: Pieces (Unfashioned Creatures)
description: Everyone has a special talent, whether it be strength, intelligence, or even a thick skull. Victor's talent is sniffing out the gifts of his fellow man and putting them to their proper use. Of course, some people need a little help realizing their full potential... Find out what monsters are made of (hint: It ain't frongs, snails, and puppy-dog tails) in "Pieces" by Shaun Noel and Mark Mullaney. The digital download includes a page from “The Monster Demands a Mate,” a comic mini-series by Josh Hechinger, with art by Dan Betro. Shaun Noel is a graduate of the State University of Geneseo. He has had various jobs in the comic industry including a summer internship at DC Comics and Wizard Magazine’s online site. A mild mannered worker ant by day, Shaun spends his nights dreaming up stories of heroic deeds and flowing capes. He is currently writing the adventures of Arianna, Jin and Daniel in his dystopian comic book City of Walls. This collaboration with A.K. Lovelace is available at CityofWalls.com and at every New York Comic con. Mark Mullaney is an Emmy-nominated artist from Boston, Massachussetts. See more of his work at www.themahk.blogspot.com. UNFASHIONED CREATURES is a collection of over twenty monstrous, moving and mirthful tributes to Mary Shelley and her legendary tale, Frankenstein. A host of creators have sewn together comic shorts, short-series and original artwork sure to inspire equal parts terror and wonder.

name: The Doctor's Wife (Unfashioned Creatures)
description: All marriages need work. And sometimes, a wife wants to get a little work done to keep the spark alive. But what happens when a woman realizes too late what's really going on behind the implants and lifts? There's more than one way to make a monster, no scalpel required. Enrica Jang and A.K. Lovelace give the Frankenstein story a nip 'n tuck with "The Doctor's Wife." Color by Sara King, letters by Mark Mullaney. The digital download includes monster-pieces “Frankenspace,” by Jason Folkes and “Rosie the Reanimator,” by Jackson McBrayor and Xander Kent. Enrica is the founder and editor-in-chief at Red Stylo Media. She is the writer and creator of Azteca, a comic series and motion comic, The House of Montresor original graphic novel, as well as editor of The Poe Twisted Anthology and Shakespeare Shaken. Her screenplay The Freshmen was made into a short film, Frienemies, winner of a CINE Golden Eagle in 2011. A.K. Lovelace is a professional storyteller and an NYC native. He has been working in comics for 10 years. His first big step was becoming an assistant for the great inker Mark Morales, a partnership, which still continues today. He has worked on various titles during this time both independent and mainstream; as well as in tv and film as a storyboard artist. His collaboration with writer Shaun Noel resulted in the creation of the mini-series City of Walls; a gritty coming of age tale in an urban scifi, industrial, super- complex. UNFASHIONED CREATURES is a collection of over twenty monstrous, moving and mirthful tributes to Mary Shelley and her legendary tale, Frankenstein. A host of creators have sewn together comic shorts, short-series and original artwork sure to inspire equal parts terror and wonder.

name: The Cask of Amontillado (printed comic)
description: Murder is only perfect when everyone knows you got away with it. After teasing for over a year, we're finally ready to debut The Cask of Amontillado, the macabre story of ultimate revenge by Edgar Allan Poe. This haunting and sinister illustrated work is by artist Jason Strutz, adapted for the comic page by writer Enrica Jang. And while you never need a reason to want to revisit Poe, this 24-page full color comic is the perfect way to prep for the release of brand new graphic novel due out next year, The House of Montresor, a full-length graphic novel by the same creative team, and a sequel to Poe's Cask of Amontillado, expanding and continuing the tale of murder and vendetta that the villainous Montresor only hints at, fifty years after committing the "perfect" crime. 24 pages Full color, floppy

name: The Cask of Amontillado (digital download)
description: Murder is only perfect when everyone knows you got away with it. After teasing for over a year, we're finally ready to debut The Cask of Amontillado, the macabre story of ultimate revenge by Edgar Allan Poe. This haunting and sinister illustrated work is by artist Jason Strutz, adapted for the comic page by writer Enrica Jang. And while you never need a reason to want to revisit Poe, this 24-page full color comic is the perfect way to prep for the release of brand new graphic novel due out next year, The House of Montresor, a full-length graphic novel by the same creative team, and a sequel to Poe's Cask of Amontillado, expanding and continuing the tale of murder and vendetta that the villainous Montresor only hints at, fifty years after committing the "perfect" crime. 24 pages Full color, PDF

name: Test Subject (Unfashioned Creatures)
description: The Great War, 1917--Major Otto Kraussmann has created the ultimate soldier to secure Germany's victory in the ongoing war. Not content to tamper with the forces of creation, Kraussman tries to alter the very nature of a man's soul. If the experiment succeeds, will the Major gloat in triumph, or cower in terror? In "Test Subject," Kevin Gunstone and Slobodan Jovanovic combine the horror of war with the darkest depths of man's cruelty. The digital download includes the art pieces “Frankenspace,” by Jason Folkes and “Rosie the Reanimator,” by Jackson McBrayor and Xander Kent. UNFASHIONED CREATURES is a collection of over twenty monstrous, moving and mirthful tributes to Mary Shelley and her legendary tale, Frankenstein. A host of creators have sewn together comic shorts, short-series and original artwork sure to inspire equal parts terror and wonder. Download this story to read it now, or pre-order the print edition from Red Stylo's store!

name: Extreme Makeover: Resurrection Edition (Unfashioned Creatures)
description:
If you're going to play God, why not do it with some style? When James decides to resurrect his dead boyfriend, he takes the opportunity to make a few "improvements" on the original design. Unfortunately, tampering with nature has consequences even James could not have predicted.

Mad science has never looked this good, in Extreme Makeover: Resurrection Edition, courtesy of Ryan Schrodt and Jarrod Perez. The digital download includes art pieces “Frankenspace,” by Jason Folkes and “Rosie the Reanimator,” by Jackson McBrayor and Xander Kent.

Ryan L. Schrodt made his professional writing debut in Mark Millar’s CLiNT Magazine in 2011 and has not stopped making comics since. Also in 2011, he released a collection of short comics, Matinee Eclectica. Upcoming work includes the one-shot King of Cool (Comic Aid Press), the graphic novella How the Krampus Saved Christmas, a Supreme story drawn by Rob Liefeld, and contributions to various anthologies. He also writes and “draws” the weekly webcomic Dear Dinosaur for www.twoforonecomics.com. When he’s not making comics, he is fanatically supporting the Vancouver Canucks and trying to eat as many different grilled animals as possible. For more about Ryan’s adventures in comics, check out his website www.schrodtcomics.com. 

Jarrod L. Perez (or TOONZi, as he signs his work) is the founder/owner of Milqtoast Comics, a company branded with high quality comics created by himself with stimulating and playful illustrations and stories, touching anywhere from stoner adventures in strange lands to random humorous social commentaries by engaging colorful characters. Picking up a comic by Jarrod is the formula for intellectual and thought provoking comedy at its best.

name: The Family Curse (Unfashioned Creatures)
description: A rare first edition of Frankenstein could hold the key to a gruesome series of murders that took place over 200 years ago. Mr. Willard wants justice for his ancestors, but will life tragically imitate art once again? Obsession is the order of the day in "First Edition" by James W. Powell, with art by Noel Tuazon. The digital download includes extras you can ONLY get online, including the short comic “Frankenmorning,” by Susan and Jeff bridges, with art by Penelope Gaylord; and “Shelley Portrait” by Trevor Hanowski.

name: Isolation Through Exploration (Unfashioned Creatures)
description: "Now that I had finished, the beauty of the dream vanished, and breathless horror and disgust filled my heart." --Mary Shelley, Frankenstein The downside to seeking out the mysteries of the universe? Sometimes, you find exactly what you were looking for. After ignoring his crew's advice, Captain Walton is alone on an alien world. And he is not alone in the dark... Writer Blake Armstrong and artist Jason Strutz put a sci-fi twist on the Walton/Frankenstein relationship with "Isolation." The digital download includes extras you can ONLY get online, including the short comic “Frankenmorning,” by Susan and Jeff bridges, with art by Penelope Gaylord; and “Shelley Portrait” by Trevor Hanowski. UNFASHIONED CREATURES is a collection of over twenty monstrous, moving and mirthful tributes to Mary Shelley and her legendary tale, Frankenstein. A host of creators have sewn together comic shorts, short-series and original artwork sure to inspire equal parts terror and wonder. Blake Armstrong is a writer and director that currently lives in Chicago, IL. His feature length screenplays have earned him some attention and awards from festivals like Slam Dance. “Isolation through Exploration” was his first story formatted for a graphic novel. When he isn’t writing, he works on set in the camera and lighting departments for various movies and television shows like Warner Brothers’ “Man of Steel” and National Geographic’s “Wicked Tuna”. If you can’t find him on set or writing, he’s most likely backpacking through a national park or brewing a batch of Scottish style ale. Jason Strutz is an illustrator and artist for the comic series The Order of Dagonet, written by Jeremy Whitley. He lives with his wife/editor in Carrboro, NC. See more of his work at StrutzIllustration.com

name: Come Together (Unfashioned Creatures)
description: Dr. Frank N. Stein can't decide if he's a neurosurgeon or a marriage counselor. When Scarlet and Malcolm pay him a visit, the good doctor's wires aren't the only thing that get crossed! R. Robert Pollak will have you in (wait for it...) stitches with the pop-art styling of "Come Together." The digital download includes extras you can ONLY get online, including the short comic “Frankenmorning,” by Susan and Jeffrey Bridges, with art by Penelope Gaylord; and “Shelley Portrait” by Trevor Hanowski. A graduate of Pratt Institute, drawing illustrations with a cartoon flair since the mid-1970′s. Studied with David Edward Byrd (Godspell, Follies). Painting studies in Pietra Santa, Italy. Designed major displays/windows as a Visual Merchandiser on Fifth Avenue for over a decade. Oversaw corporate publications as art director for five years at the JC Penney Company’s world headquarters. Teaching art and many other subjects for the NYC DOE for more than twenty years. Many pen/ink illustrations have been published in an assortment of magazines/newspapers. Starting with the SoHo Weekly News and Saks Fifth Avenue, to more recently The Shawangunk Journal, The Ellenville Public Library and Museum, and historic Green-Wood Cemetery in Brooklyn.

name: Pock-it Monster (Unfashioned Creatures)
description: You know the rules: the boy with the nicest toy wins. Some people will do anything to have the best toy on the block. But what if that toy has a life of its own? Writer and wrtist Blake Packard brings to surreal and disturbing life a story exploring Shelley's theme of what it means to value and discard life frivolously and without care. The digital download includes extras you can ONLY get online, including a BONUSpage from “Smooshenstein,” a mini-series by Damien Lucchese, art by Maritsa Patrinos, featured as part of extras in the digital downloads Blake Packard is an illustration graduate from Northern Illinois University and is currently a product development manager designing sculpture and decorative art. Visit his website: www.blakepackard.com

name: Epiphany (Unfashioned Creatures)
description: What fate could be worse than existing as a hideous monstrosity, shunned by all of humanity? How about living with that curse forever? Sometimes, the only solution is to make new friends...literally. Written by Emiliyan and Stanimir Valev, and beautifully illustrated by A. I. Miller, "Epiphany" offers a fresh, hopeful take on the Creature's doomed tale. The digital download includes a BONUS page from “Smooshenstein,” a mini-series by Damien Lucchese, art by Maritsa Patrinos, featured as part of extras in this digital download. Emiliyan and Stanimir Valev are two brothers and comic creators from Bulgaria. Share their visions at http://eandspresent.blogspot.com A.I.Miller, born in 1987 in Fort Worth, Texas, is a figurative painter, digital artist, writer and comic artist. Read more about his work at www.aimiller.com

name: Big Man (Unfashioned Creatures)
description: The "Big Man" is the local 'boogey-man' for the kids at play on a small vacation island off the coast of Maine. But it only takes one careless moment for a magical summer to becomes a lifetime's regret...and the local monster is an all-too-convenient scapegoat. Writer C. M. Beckett and artist Gary Fitzgerald explore the coming-of-age aspects of Mary Shelley's great novel in "Big Man," a story of child-like desires and adult consequences. The digital download includes extras you can ONLY get online, including a BONUSpage from “Smooshenstein,” a mini-series by Damien Lucchese, art by Maritsa Patrinos, featured as part of extras in this digital download. C. M. Beckett has also written for Pulse, contributed to the flash fiction sites 50 Years From Now and Elephant Words, had short stories published by Ape Entertainment, Dark Recesses Press, and Top Shelf Comics. You can see more of his work at www.warrior27.com and www.readingwatchmen.com. Gary Fitzgerald is (among other things) a writer and illustrator. Gary’s most recent published work was drawing Red Plains (written by Caryn A Tate), which was initially released through Topshelf 2.0 before going to to be available through Graphicly, iTunes and other sources. More can be seen at http://cheekyfish.blogspot.com

name: Frankenstein on Mars (Unfashioned Creatures)
description:
Monsters...in...SPAAAACE!  Frankenstein's misunderstood monster takes a giant leap for mankind when he becomes the first man (...well, "creature") on Mars.  However, a life of exploration and solitude is interrupted when he again encounters humans, and learns that some things never change.

Writer Aaron Duran and artist Jess L'Heureux capture the tragic appeal of Mary Shelley's monsters in this poignant tale.  The digital download includes a BONUS page from "Monsters and the Monsters Who Make Them," a mini-series written by James McGee and illustrated by Alex Cormack.

name: Last Man Standing (Unfashioned Creatures)
description:
Hey, you got Zombies in my Frankenstein!  In the midst of an undead apocalypse, one scientist tries to sustain the human race by cloning himself (again.)  Unfortunately, things don't work out exactly as planned.  But then, do they ever?

Writer Monica Valentinelli and artist Josie Pi Grant bring a modern twist on the first, great literary zombie.  The digital download includes a BONUS page from "Monsters and the Monsters Who Make Them," a mini-series written by James McGee and illustrated by Alex Cormack.

name: TORCHBEARER #4
description:
TORCHBEARER #4, "Corporomachy"

Following the latest attack at a facility operated by Prometheus, Inc, the board of directors are meeting to discuss their latest operations throughout the galaxy, and discover just who is behind their recent attacks: the Torchbearers. 

But, just who are the Torchbearers? 

For hundreds of years, Prometheus, Inc., has served as a shining example of how corporations can bring peace and prosperity to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. 

...But it's all been a front. 

They've been amassing power and resources, biding their time to take over and that time is now. 

TORCHBEARER is a science fiction epic focusing on Cayoti, the leader of a resistance movement, and Selene Elis, a mole within Prometheus, and their actions to stop Prometheus Inc. before it's too late. 

Writer: Nicolas Dedual
Pencils and Inks: Michael Montenat
Colors: Ron Riley
Letters: Dave Lanphear
Editor: M.I. Annoni
Cover by: Michael Montenat with colors by Ron Riley

name: My Brother, My Self (Unfashioned Creatures)
description:
Talk about holding a grudge!  Victor Frankenstein's infamous experiment left his entire family dead...save for younger brother, Ernest. When the middle child takes up the "family business," will he put to right Victor's crimes? Or will the violence just go on...and on...

The forgotten Frankenstein brother takes center stage in this chilling and bloody tale by Kenneth Whitfield and Nick Hoffman. The digital download includes a BONUS page from "Monsters and the Monsters Who Make Them," a mini-series written by James McGee and illustrated by Alex Cormack.

name: Drago Bentley: Space Detective
description:
Drago Bentley: Space Detective "The Bioloid Acendancy"
254-pages
Full color
Collecting Chapters #1-8

Drago Bentley: Space Detective is a sci-fi crime tech-noir story about a gifted Private Detective, Drago Bentley. It's the early 22nd century and anything can be implanted and reclaimed--just ask Joe.  Joe is made blind when his optical implants are switched off and is forced to reanimate a hated-android as “seeing eye dog” to solve the case of a missing billionaire, and in the process expose the truth behind a militant group of high level androids and a corrupt senator hell-bent on controlling the world.

Based on a feature script by Australian writer Joseph Kisch, and illustrated by artist Dave Acosta, the first eight issues of this sci-fi comic book is bound in a 254-page full color graphic novel, available for the first time in the United States right here!

categories.name: Drago Bentley: Space Detective (Idiot's Lantern/Red Stylo)

name: City of Walls #1, full color digital download
description: Kowloon City, the great walled oasis in Asia, cut off from the rest of the world. It is its own sovereign nation, and the word of the Triads is law. Life in Kowloon is not easy for anyone, especially Daniel Jin and Ariana. And though these three best friends may be from different backgrounds, soon they must come together in a common purpose: escape! Now re-mastered and in FULL COLOR, City of Walls is a new series by creators Shaun Noel and Abede Lovelace, with inks by Mark Morales. Published by Standalone Productions in cooperation with Red Stylo Press. Full color, 28 pages.

name: City of Walls #1 in COLOR!
description: Kowloon City, the great walled oasis in Asia, cut off from the rest of the world. It is its own sovereign nation, and the word of the Triads is law. Life in Kowloon is not easy for anyone, especially Daniel Jin and Ariana. And though these three best friends may be from different backgrounds, soon they must come together in a common purpose: escape! Now re-mastered and in FULL COLOR, City of Walls is a new series by creators Shaun Noel and Abede Lovelace, with inks by Mark Morales. Published by Standalone Productions in cooperation with Red Stylo Press. Full color, 28 pages.

name: TORCHBEARER #3
description:
After the events of Carthulla, Prometheus Inc., must pay for its crimes. Events are set in motion that will have unexpected consequences for both Prometheus and Cayoti. As Cayoti and his collaborators plan their next steps, The Collectors are tightening the noose. Will they be able to capture Cayoti in time?

For hundreds of years, Prometheus, Inc., has served as a shining example of how corporations can bring peace and prosperity to the farthest reaches of the galaxy.
 
...But it's all been a front.
 
They've been amassing power and resources, biding their time to take over and that time is now.
 
TORCHBEARER is a science fiction epic focusing on Cayoti, the leader of a resistance movement, and Selene Elis, a mole within Prometheus, and their actions to stop Prometheus Inc. before it's too late.
 
Written by Nicolas Dedual with Artwork by Dennis Calero (X-Men Noir, Green Lantern, Solar.) This is Issue #3 of this incredible new series poised to set the comic world ablaze!

name: Donate $50 to Boston Children's Hospital, get $10 off from Red Stylo Media
description:
Get a coupon code for $10 off any purchase in the Red Stylo Media Store when you donate $50 to Boston Children's Hospital. We will make the donation in your name and send you the receipt for tax purposes. 

We add $1 to help recover PayPal fees.

If you wish to donate to Boston children's Hospital directly, visit their site here: http://giving.childrenshospital.org/

name: City of Walls #1 (b/w, digital download)
description: Kowloon City, the great walled oasis in Asia, cut off from the rest of the world. It is its own sovereign nation, and the word of the Triads is law. Life in Kowloon is not easy for anyone, especially Daniel Jin and Ariana. And though these three best friends may be from different backgrounds, soon they must come together in a common purpose: escape! City of Walls is a new series by creators Shaun Noel and Abede Lovelace, with inks by Mark Morales. Published by Standalone Productions in cooperation with Red Stylo Press. B/W, 24 pages.

name: TORCHBEARER #2
description:
It's been one month since the initial attack at Hyperia, and Prometheus is nowhere close to discovering who's behind it. But this latest attack is just too big to ignore. 

Prometheus is sending their big guns. Pray you don't get in their way.

For hundreds of years, Prometheus, Inc., has served as a shining example of how corporations can bring peace and prosperity to the farthest reaches of the galaxy.
 
...But it's all been a front.
 
They've been amassing power and resources, biding their time to take over and that time is now.
 
TORCHBEARER is a science fiction epic focusing on Cayoti, the leader of a resistance movement, and Selene Elis, a mole within Prometheus, and their actions to stop Prometheus Inc. before it's took late.
 
Written by Nicolas Dedual with Artwork by Dennis Calero (X-Men Noir, Green Lantern, Solar.) This is Issue #2 of this incredible new series poised to set the comic world ablaze!

name: Eldorado Diptych by Robert Pollak
description:
In the land of the dead or in Hell, in the shadow or in the night this gallant Knight searches for Eldorado. Robert Pollak's re-imagining of Poe's poem, "Eldorado" with stark black & white visuals, with subtle nods to Poe's Poem and the infinite search for the lost city of gold, Eldorado.

This diptych piece shows both illustrations on the same 18x12 print.

R. Robert Pollak is a graduate of the Pratt Institute, drawing illustrations with a cartoon flair since the mid-1970s. Many of his pen and ink illustrations have appeared in an assortment of publications over the years, starting with The Soho Weekly News and Saks Fifth Avenue, to more recently The Shawangunk Journal, The Ellenville Public Library/Museum, and Historic Green-Wood Cemetery in Brooklyn. Illustrations have been exhibited at gallery shows in Soho, Dumbo, Harlem, and upstate NY. In 2012, an independent comic book of pin-ups by Pollak, titled Mermaids, Vixens, and Wenches, A Pin-Up Gallery, is planned for release and will include the work of many other fine cartoonists.

name: Curse of the 13th Baktun (digital)
description: Two local experts in ancient Mayan scripts are pressed into service by an ambitious archaeologist who locates a lost ruin through—dreams? old legends? sophisticated satellite imagery? What they uncover in the jungle on December 21, 2012, the date when the 13th Maya baktun ends, is a nightmare. Marta Tanrikulu is a writer and contributor to Red Stylo Media's anthology series Poe Twisted and Shakespeare Shaken. Read her work and bio at Redstylo.com

name: Zombie Hamlet: Shakespeare Shaken
description:
What happens when 2012 Eisner-Nominated Jeremy Whitley (Princeless) does Shakespeare? He turns it into a zombie massacre (of course)! With art by Gabriel Dunston, this original take on one of Shakespeare's most well known stories is as funny as it is gruesome.  When "Emo Boy" Hamlet is bit by his dead, zombified father, all hell breaks loose in Denmark and the only solution is....braaaaains.

Zombie Hamlet appears in Shakespeare Shaken Anthology and as this PDF download, which contains all the gruesome comedy of Zombie Hamlet for 1.99!

Jeremy Whitley is the Eisner nominated writer/creator of the hit all-ages title Princeless and the upcoming The Order of Dagonet. 
Gabriel Dunston is a cartoonist/illustrator living in Garner, North Carolina. He has made journal comics and comic short stories and is now working on his first full graphic novel.

name: TORCHBEARER (print)
description:
**GET THE DIGITAL DOWNLOAD FREE WHEN YOUR ORDER THE PRINT VERSION OF THIS COMIC!!**

For hundreds of years, Prometheus, Inc.,  has served as a shining example of how corporations can bring peace and prosperity to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. 

...But it's all been a front. 

They've been amassing power and resources, biding their time to take over and that time is now. 

TORCHBEARER is a science fiction epic focusing on Cayoti, the leader of a resistance movement, and Selene Elis, a mole within Prometheus, and their actions to stop Prometheus Inc. before it's took late.

Written by Nicolas Dedual with Artwork by Dennis Calero (X-Men Noir, Green Lantern, Solar.) This is Issue #1 of a bi-monthly series, that is poised to set the comic world ablaze!

name: TORCHBEARER (digital)
description:
Prometheus, Inc., for hundreds of years has served as a shining example of how corporations can bring peace and prosperity to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. 

...But it's all been a front. 

They've been amassing power and resources, biding their time to take over and that time is now. 

TORCHBEARER is a science fiction epic focusing on Cayoti, the leader of a resistance movement, and Selene Elis, a mole within Prometheus, and their actions to stop Prometheus Inc. before it's took late.

Written by Nicolas Dedual with Artwork by Dennis Calero (X-Men Noir, Green Lantern, Solar.) This is Issue #1 of a bi-monthly series, that is poised to set the comic world ablaze!

name: Shakespeare Shaken in the Art of Laura Guzzo
description: Artist Laura Guzzo contributed four incredible pin-ups reimagining characters from The Tragedy of Hamlet and "A Midsummer Night's Dream" in this collection of pinups for Shakespeare Shaken, an anthology of original comics and art inspired by William Shakespeare. See the pieces in the printed anthology, or OWN the entire collection of masterful work as poster prints! All of the pieces are 11"x17" full color prints and include: "Ophelia's Revenge" "Detective Horatio" "The Ass Man" "Try Ear Poison" Laura Guzzo is a freelance illustrator whose award-winning artwork has been featured in galleries across the East Coast, in addition to appearing on book covers and t-shirts. Laura enjoys working in many different media, including colored pencils, watercolor, and collage. She draws inspiration from tarot cards and stained glass, as well as from 1950′s pin-up girls and the art nouveau movement. She currently works out of her studio in South Jersey and is a part of the artist’s collective Rough Sketch Studios. Most recent projects include Amaranthine (Machine Age Productions) and PrinceLess (Action Lab Comics). To see more, visit: www.LauraGuzzoArt.com

name: The Hamelin Murders, Gunpowder and Shakespeare Shaken
description:
Gunpowder is back! The lovable, crime-fighting, sexually-confused feline teams up again with Officers Harrington and Lansdowne, and plays an unwitting part in a dastardly plot for power back at the precinct. Meanwhile, our clueless cops try to unravel a case of literary homicide at the Hamelin mansion. Hijinx ensue!

Alex Cormack is the author and artist who first introduced the intrepid kitty in "The Tell Tale Cat," one of the comic shorts in The Poe Twisted Anthology. THE HAMELIN MURDERS brings back all of the zany main characters from that story, while introducing some new ones borrowed,  twisted, shaken and stirred from William Shakespeare's "Hamlet" and "Macbeth."

This download is jam-packed with a giant extra: the UNCUT, original version of Alex Cormack's The Hamelin Murders. The file also includes a BONUS pin-up from artist Laura Guzzo!

name: S.H.R.E.W., Shakespeare Shaken meets the perfect (bionic) woman
description:
Kat is a perfect specimen of female spitfire and grace, and her corporate handlers in the Super-human Research, Education and Weaponization project can see her potential. But it's Kat's strength that also keeps her from submitting to her S.H.R.E.W. training, and so the programmers resort to bringing in the mysterious and sinister Doctor Petru to help Kat stay the course...

Shakespeare Shaken meets the perfect (bionic) woman in S.H.R.E.W., written by Sherezada Kent (author of ELDORADO from Poe Twisted), with art by Jarrod Perez; color and letters by Mark Mullaney ("Star-Crossed", "Zombie Cruise", and "The System of Doctor Canne and Professor Bulle".) 

This download includes a special note from the author, as well as a BONUS pin-up from artist Laura Guzzo!

name: Falstaff's Arena, Shakespeare Shaken meets Lucha Libre
description:
To the finish! Lucha libre manager, Falstaff, has a nice little business fixing matches and raking in the pesos with his under-the-table business partner, Bad Boy Prince. But Hotspurs is one luchador who is sick of taking falls and watching his career flounder while he's in his prime. It's a bout for Masks vs. Hair, and this time, Falstaff doesn't get to decide who the winner will be!

Shakespeare Shaken continues the tradition of Shakespeare and men in tights in FALSTAFF's ARENA, a story borrowing characters from "Henry IV," tumbled together with Mexican wrestling!

Written by Marta Tanrikulu (writer of ZOMBIE CRUISE, from Poe Twisted) and the debut of artist Michael Reisner; colors by Ashley Lanni (artist for Red & Violet), letters by Gabriel Dunston (artist for ZOMBIE HAMLET.) This file also includes a BONUS pin-up from artist Laura Guzzo!

name: Portrait of an Author, Poe vs. Poe rages on
description: Artists Matthew J. Fletcher and Jason Strutz are going Poe to Poe, and YOU CHOOSE FLETCHER! If you've happened by the Red Stylo Media table in artist alley at a convention any time in the last year, chances are good you have stopped dead in your tracks, mid-aisle. You've been frozen by the soulful, melancholic gaze of the Dark Master of American gothic fiction, Edgar Allan Poe. (Those piercing eyes, staring out at you, straight through to your soul.) "Portrait of Poe" is by artist Matthew J. Fletcher, from The Poe Twisted Anthology. The print is 12 x 18, and is in the running against one other print in a battle for the title of BEST POE EVER! (Matthew J. Fletcher fans can also download his newest comic from the Shakespeare Shaken comic anthology, "Wheresoever Lies Tragedy If Love Endureth Forever," written by Seth Mullins.)

name: Hideous Cuteness, Poe vs. Poe rages on
description: Artists Matthew J. Fletcher and Jason Strutz are going Poe to Poe, and YOU CHOOSE STRUTZ! If you've happened by the Red Stylo Media table in artist alley at a convention any time in the last year, chances are good you have stopped dead in your tracks, mid-aisle. You were jolted into suprised, baffled laughter at the crazed figure of Poe in mid-strike as he tries to cobble cuteness and light safely away and out of sight under the floorboards. (It was the unicorn that threw you, right? Yeah, us too.) "The Beating of the Hideous Cuteness" is a vignette by artist Jason Strutz, from The Poe Twisted Anthology. The print is a full color poster, 12 x 18, and is in the running against one other print in Red Stylo Media's first ever battle for title of BEST POE EVER! (Jason Strutz fans can also download his newest comic from the Shakespeare Shaken comic anthology, "All Our Yesterdays," written by Richard Douek.)

name: R. Robert Pollak's Shakespeare Shaken Pin-up Parade!
description:
Artist R. Robert Pollak  contributed five retro-style pin-ups for Shakespeare Shaken, an anthology of original comics and art inspired by William Shakespeare. See the pieces in the printed anthology, or OWN the entire collection of masterful work as poster prints!

All of the pieces are 11"x17" prints and include:
"Romeo and Juliet at Studio 54"
"I Have You Now, Cleopatra!"
"The Ghost on the Walk" (from "The Tragedy of Hamlet")
"Slapstick Taming of the Shrew"
"Titania and Bottom"(from "A Midsummer Night's Dream")

You can get the entire bundle or select an individual poster from our drop down menu!

R. Robert Pollak is a graduate of the Pratt Institute, drawing illustrations with a cartoon flair since the mid-1970s. Many of his pen and ink illustrations have appeared in an assortment of publications over the years, starting with The Soho Weekly News and Saks Fifth Avenue, to more recently The Shawangunk Journal, The Ellenville Public Library/Museum, and Historic Green-Wood Cemetery in Brooklyn. Illustrations have been exhibited at gallery shows in Soho, Dumbo, Harlem, and upstate NY. In 2012, an independent comic book of pin-ups by Pollak, titled Mermaids, Vixens, and Wenches, A Pin-Up Gallery, is planned for release and will include the work of many other fine cartoonists.

options.name: The Ghost on the Walk (from "The Tragedy of Hamlet")
Titania and Bottom (from "A Midsummer Night's Dream")

name: Dark Mistress, a bloody photo-comic from Shakespeare Shaken
description:
Work can be a cruel mistress. D.A. Eric Stratford is on the verge of closing a huge, high-profile murder case and he's willing to put his own life--and wife--on hold to keep a brutal lady-killer in prison forever. But what if he has the wrong man behind bars?

"Dark Mistress" is written by Ryan Schrodt, with photo-art by Mark Mullaney. This bloody mystery re-imagines Sonnets 127-154 and the Dark Lady of Shakespeare fame and is the only photo-comic in the Shakespeare Shaken collection. The file also includes a bonus pin-up from artist R. Robert Pollak.

name: The Play Is the Thing, Sonnets vs. Globes from Shakespeare Shaken
description:
It's Saturday night in Shakespeare, Ohio, and the Sonnets and Globes are battling for the Championship. But when Coach Macbeth encourages his players to play a little less than fair, it's up to Viola and her twin-brother Sebastian to even the score!

This basketball game is an all-ages mash-up of characters and plot-twists from William Shakespeare's most famous plays, including "Twelfth Night," "Othello," "Julius Caesar," and "Hamlet." Written by Shaun Noel, with art by Andre Frattino. This file also includes a bonus pin-up from artist R. Robert Pollak!

name: The Iron Tongue of Midnight, a tale of fae and destiny from Shakespeare Shaken
description:
"I see Queen Mab hath been with you." Destiny and future fame are the stuff of dreams in THE IRON TONGUE OF MIDNIGHT, and Queen Mab, the lovely and ruthless fairy monarch of the night, has a mission for her human servant Mercutio. 

Written entirely in iambic pentameter by Dirk Manning, and illustrated by The Brothers Moogk-Soulis, THE IRON TONGUE OF MIDNIGHT reimagines the role of Mercutio from William Shakespeare's "Romeo & Juliet." 

This file includes bonus material, including a pin-up from artist R. Robert Pollak and Shakespeare themed strips from Post-Script, a web comic written and illustrated by The Brothers Moogk-Soulis.

name: The Hempest, Shakespeare Shaken on your pizza
description:
A brave crew of eight set sail for the New World, only to scuttle on the shoal of a mysterious desert island. And so--as any self-respecting crew of Irish seamen would do--they put out an immediate distress call...for pizza!

"One Million Bags of Their Best Sligo Rags"
 or "How I Came to Stop Worrying and Love Greek Pizza"
or "The Hempest." Call it what you will, but strap yourselves in and prepare for the craziest high-seas adventure anyone has ever had on dry land! Andrew Jerz both writes and illustrates this fantastical tale of misadventure, some of it even in iambic tetrameter(Intrigued yet? Thought so.) inspired by characters from William Shakespeare's "The Tempest."

This download includes EXCLUSIVE BONUS CONTENT, with tidbits from and about Crazyman Jerz, as well as concept sketches and extra panels. In addition, the file includes a page from "Brave World," another parody inspired by Shakespeare's "The Tempest," from the mind of A.I. Miller.

name: All Our Yesterdays, Shakespeare Shaken in space!
description:
Mac Bethad, Star Emperor of Man, is on the verge of losing his life and empire to rebel forces when his ship's console inhabited by sentient artificial intelligence offers a final solution. William Shakespeare's "Macbeth" meets "2001 Space Odyssey" in ALL OUR YESTERDAYS, a dystopian tale from writer Richard Douek, with art by Jason Strutz!

This download includes a fully illustrated and colored ALTERNATE ENDING and bonus sketch pages readers can ONLY get online, plus a page from"Zombie Hamlet" a Shakespeare Shaken mini-series written by Eisner-nominee Jeremy Whitley, with art by Gabriel Dunston!

name: No. 130 For Love, Steampunk meets Rome in Shakespeare Shaken
description:
No. 130 FOR LOVE, the tragic tale of a man given the chance to be consort to a goddess if only he will agree to renounce his mortal mate. Inspired by Shakespeare's "Sonnet 130," this highly-stylized comic story combines grand Elizabethan drama with the savage cruelty of Ancient Rome, packaged in gorgeous and ornate steam-punk mech.

Story by Amber Love and Kristen McHugh, with art by Jhazmine Ruiz. This download includes sketch pages and alternate cover roughs readers can ONLY get online, plus a page from"Zombie Hamlet" a Shakespeare Shaken mini-series written by Eisner-nominee Jeremy Whitley, with art by Gabriel Dunston!

name: Shakespeare Shaken, a comic anthology
description:
Friends, countrymen! SHAKESPEARE SHAKEN is a comic anthology of original graphic works (including short comic stories, short series and vignettes) inspired by the plays, poetry and life of William Shakespeare.  The folio features work from over thirty comic artists and writers.

Full-color trade paperback with over 200 pages. Read more about the anthology at RedStylo.com!

name: Mantua County, the Apothecary's tale from Shakespeare Shaken
description:
"The world is not thy friend, nor the world's law..." 

A young man seeking a quick exit shows up at the doorstep of a retired chemist, and the money is just too princely a sum to refuse. The chemist comes out of exile for one last job, to pay his poverty...and his conscience. Mantua County is the setting for the Apothecary's tale, the poisoner in William Shakespear's "Romeo and Juliet."

Story by Erik Radvon with art by Seva Khibkin.

BONUS: this download includes a page from"Zombie Hamlet" a Shakespeare Shaken mini-series written by Eisner-nominee Jeremy Whitley, with art by Gabriel Dunston!

name: Surviving Shakespeare, Shakespeare Shaken meets Survivor
description:
A reality television crew and some contestants have invaded the enchanted forest, but Oberon has no patience for their "real world" frivolities. It's time to get some skin in the game, and Oberon knows just the fellow to make things interesting.

The Bard of Avon meets Reality T.V. (and monkeys!) in "Surviving Shakespeare”, inspired by William Shakespeare’s “A Midsummer Night’s Dream.” Written by Mitchell Hyman and Andrew Jerz, with art by Shawn Harbin; color and letters by Alex Cormack.

This download includes sketch pages and extras readers can ONLY get online, plus a page from"Zombie Hamlet" a Shakespeare Shaken mini-series written by Eisner-nominee Jeremy Whitley, with art by Gabriel Dunston!

name: Wheresoever Lies Tragedy if Love Endureth Forever?
description:
His desire for revenge even beyond the grave cost the life of his son and birthed a millenia of strife that destroyed his Kingdom. Can the ghost of a long-dead girl show King Hamlet a path to peace?

Forgiveness is the key to eternal rest in "Wheresoever Lies Tragedy if Love Endureth Forever?" a haunting tale in the voice of King Hamlet, the ghost of immortal fame in William Shakespeare's "The Tragedy of Hamlet."

Written by Seth Mullins with art by Matthew Fletcher; colors by Mark mullaney, letters by Erica Schultz. 

BONUS: this download includes a page from"Zombie Hamlet" a Shakespeare Shaken mini-series written by Eisner-nominee Jeremy Whitley, with art by Gabriel Dunston!

name: Brave World, a Shakespeare Shaken series
description: An old man named Frederick (who claims to be the President of the United States) and his 3-year-old daughter, Miranda, are marooned on a tiny jungle-covered island. Mystery and adventure await in "Brave World," a quirky shake-up of Shakespeare's wonderful drama,"The Tempest."

name: Star-crossed, romance by the book from Shakespeare Shaken
description:
Kiss by the book. Or is it, you kiss when you're booked? Romeo and Julie can't seem to decide how their second-chance at life and love in the happily thereafter should end.

What if those two whiny teenagers had lived to love instead? Shakespeare's "Romeo and Juliet" gets a sequel in this hilarious short from writer James McGee and artist Mark Mullaney!

The digital download includes extras you can ONLY get online, including the original script and character design pages. The file also includes a BONUS page from BRAVE NEW WORLS, a twist on "The Tempest" from artist A.I. Miller!

name: War of Studios, a Shakespeare Shaken production
description:
When it comes to shooting stars, tabloid shutterbug Jimmy Doohan is the best in the business. Doohan gets a shot at the big time when Tinsel Town's mob-run movie studios take turns bumping off each other's best actors!

Shakespeare takes on the silver screen in this noir trip through 1930's Hollywoodland in WAR OF STUDIOS. Story by Bobby Harps, with art by David Fernandez; color/letters by Andre Frattino.

name: Red & Violet, a narco-tale from Shakespeare Shaken
description:
To be loved is a great and terrible thing for two double-agents trafficking in the business of synthetic affection.

Lovers meet a terrible fate in RED & VIOLET, a twisted narco-tale of betrayal with re-imagined characters from William Shakespeare's "Antony and Cleopatra." 

Story by Jon Santana, with art by Ashley Lanni; letters by Erica Schultz. The download includes special features readers will ONLY get online, including ten pages of original character designs and alternate panels!

name: AZTECA: Ciudad Paradiso #4 (digital edition)
description:
AZTECA #4

There's only so much bloodshed a city can take and Quetzecan, Mexico is about to crack. Councilwoman Pilar Hererra is poised to take power, but the silent, lethal menace terrorizing the Cartel is watching from the shadows, ready to strike at any moment. Overseeing everything is the death's head stare of Santisima Muerte and bodies continue to drop as the clock ticks down on 2012...

Debuting artist Benjamin Frazier and Alex Cormack in this 4th installment in the AZTECA series, written by Enrica Jang.

name: AZTECA: Ciudad Paradiso Volume 1
description:
The AZTECA trade paperback is here! Collecting issues #1-3 of this amazing new series, the trade paperback includes sketchbook and BONUS material, including a sneak peek at the first chapter from AZTECA #4!

A silent killer is cutting up bad guys in the resort city of Quetzecan, Mexico. All of the victims are soldiers in the Cardenas drug cartel and the body count is rising. Strange Aztec symbols drawn in blood at every scene only hint at the killer's agenda as the clock ticks down to the end of 2012. The beginning of the end is NOW!

Story by Enrica Jang; art by Jhazmine Ruiz. 150 pages, full color trade paperback.

name: AZTECA:Ciudad Paradiso #1
description:
A silent killer is cutting up bad guys in the resort city of Quetzecan, Mexico. A trio of corner drug dealers.  Five hoods in a warehouse.  All of the victims are soldiers in the Cardenas Cartel and the body count is rising.  Strange Aztec symbols drawn in blood at every grisly scene only hint at the killer's agenda as the clock ticks down to 2012.  The beginning of the end is NOW...

First run print, full color, 36 pages, no ads.

name: The POE TWISTED Anthology
description:
Welcome to The POE TWISTED Anthology, a collection of original comic art inspired by the fiction and poetry of Edgar Allan Poe.  Not Poe... Poe twisted!

"Take the characters or setting from your favorite Edgar Allan Poe story, twist them, and make something new."  The Poe Twisted Anthology is a challenge to a new crop of artists and writers to be inspired by Poe, rather than simply retell him.  Clever, haunting, and with an eclectic mix of styles and genres, this collection of original comics is a graphic tribute to the dark master of American Gothic fiction.

Created by Poe fans, for Poe lovers everywhere.

Full color, trade paperback, 90-pages

name: POE TWISTED Digital Bundle
description:
All seven of the Poe Twisted Anthology stories for one special price!  October 7 is Edgar Allan Poe's Death Day anniversary, and we're offering all of our tribute stories together in his honor!  The Poe Twisted Anthology is a collection of original comics, inspired by the writings of E.A. Poe. Not Poe... Poe twisted.

Downloads include special features not available in the print edition!

7 pdf files, download from email when purchase is complete.

name: AZTECA: Ciudad Paradiso #1 (digital edition)
description: Why wait?  Read the digital edition on your computer or iPad.  A silent killer is cutting up bad guys in the resort city of Quetzecan, Mexico.  A trio of corner drug dealers.  Five hoods in a warehouse.  All of the victims are soldiers in the Cardenas Cartel and the body count is rising. Strange Aztec symbols drawn in blood at every grisly scene only hint at the killer's agenda as the clock ticks down 2012.  The beginning of the end is NOW...

name: AZTECA: Ciudad Paradiso #2 (digital edition)
description:
A killer is stalking soldiers in El Serpiente's crew and the message is clear: no one is safe or beyond.  But even if the drug lord can't find the mysterious killer stalking his men, he can cut down the Quetzecan townspeople emboldened by the vigilante killer who dare to stand up to the cartel.  In the sleepy resort city of Quetzecan, Mexico, the blood bath has only just begun!

42 pages, full color

name: AZTECA: Ciudad Paradiso #3 (digital edition)
description:
The long-awaited next chapter in the AZTECA series is finally here!  Nuria Medina and her father, Hector, are the newest victims in the Cartel's war to keep control of Quetzecan, Mexico.  But no one can possibly know what's really at stake until the blood of innocents reveals an ancient evil lying in wait in a world beyond this one.  The beginning of the end is now!

Featuring new cover art by Scott Ambruson and the ink/color/lettering stylings of Alex Cormack!

Digital download, color PDF, 40 pages.  Story by Enrica Jang; pencils, Jhazmine Ruiz; ink/color/letters, Andre Frattino and Alex Cormack

name: Retro-Skulls T-Shirt
description:
Black cotton T-shirt with AZTECA retro-skulls design

Sizes small, medium, and XXXL please allow extra two weeks for shipping.

name: Southside of Dreams (spoken word for AZTECA)
description:
Newest offering, by Poet Without Apology "The Southside of Dreams".  This piece was inspired by and created especially for AZTECA by the incredible spoken word poet, Poet Without Apology. Music/mix by Brian Galloway.

"Sur de Suenos", English

name: Zombie Cruise, a POE TWISTED tale (with special features)
description:
Trouble and plague break our on a Hawaii-bound cruise ship in this bio-medical thriller, ZOMBIE CRUISE.  The trip was supposed to be good for Lydia's health.  Instead it turned into everyone's death!  Includes special features and a message from the artist!

"Zombie Cruise" is an original comic short, written by Marta Tanrikulu and with art by Mark Mullaney.  Inspired by E.A. Poe's, "The Oblong Box". 1 of 13 pieces in The POE TWISTED Anthology, a collection of original stories and art inspired by the Dark Master of American Gothic fiction, Edgar Allan Poe.  Edited by Enrica Jang.  Published by Red Stylo Media.

Full color, 16 pages including special features from artist, Mark Mullaney.

name: The Tell Tale Cat, a POE TWISTED tale (with a tail)
description:
Beat cops Harrington and Lansdowne collar more than they bargained for in this hilarious noire police comic, The TELL TALE CAT.  This story is a parody of events in Edgar Allan Poe's classic tales, "The Black Cat" and "The Tell Tale Heart". Original story, art and BONUS features from artist Alex Cormack!

This is the second Poe Twisted tale with art from Poe-tributor Alex Cormack, and one of fifteen pieces in The POE TWISTED Anthology, a collection of original comics and art inspired by the Dark Master of American Gothic fiction, Edgar Allan Poe.  Not Poe... Poe twisted!  Edited by Enrica Jang and published by Red Stylo Media!

Full color, 16 pages, Bonus features include alternate covers and original sketches.

name: The System of Doctor Canne and Professor Bulle, a POE TWISTED story
description:
Have someone special for dinner with THE SYSTEM OF DOCTOR CANNE AND PROFESSOR BULLE, a macabre little comic set in a free-range asylum where the hospital staff practice the most unorthodox of treatments to best keep the patients...down.  A sequel to Edgar Allan Poe's tale of insanity run amok, "The System of Doctor Tarr and Professor Fether." The download includes special features you will ONLY get online, including the original short story from author/artist Mark Mullaney on which the comic is based!

20 pages, full color. BONUS content includes an original short story from artist Mark Mullaney

name: The After Party, a POE TWISTED story
description: Wesley Prince has credit cards, his father's mansion all to himself... and enough drugs to kill his entire senior graduating class. Kyle Richey and Benjamin Frazier thrill and kill in THE AFTER PARTY a twisted spin on the phantasmagoric Poe classic "Masque of the Red Death." THE AFTER PARTY is written by Kyle Richey, author of his own series, Accord. See more of artist Ben Frazier's work at http://onefangcobra.blogspot.com. Mark Mullaney (color and letters) is also the artist and artist/author behind two more stories in the POE TWISTED Anthology: ZOMBIE CRUISE and THE SYSTEM OF DR. CANNE AND PROFESSOR BULLE. THE AFTER PARTY is 1 of 15 pieces in The POE TWISTED Anthology, a collection of original stories and art inspired by the Dark Master of American Gothic fiction, Edgar Allan Poe. Edited by Enrica Jang. Published by Red Stylo Media. 14 pages, full color PDF

name: Eldorado, a POE TWISTED story (with special features)
description:
The sun sets on a 300-year quest for fabled glory and gold in ELDORADO, an original comic story by Sherezada Windham-Kent and Alex Cormack.  A zombie Western, inspired be Edgar Allan Poe's poem of the same name.  Includes 8 pages of special features, including messages from both the writer and artist!

ELDORADO is written by film director Sherezada Windham-Kent (Everything I needed to Know About Zombies I learned from the Movies 2009).  Alex Cormack is the artist and author behind another story in the POE TWISTED Anthology, THE TELL TALE CAT, also set for digital release this month.  Inspired by E.A. Poe's "Eldorado". 1 of 13 pieces in The POE TWISTED Anthology, a collection of original stories and art inspired by the Dark Master of American gothic fiction, Edgar Allan Poe.  Edited by Enrica Jang.  Published by Red Stylo Media.

20 pages, full color, special features

name: Dead Man's Hand, a POE TWISTED story (with special features)
description:
It's just another frat house poker night for college card-shark, Toby.  But Toby goes all in when a mysterious, devilish coed calls his bluff.  Includes special features and a message from the artist!

"Dead Man's Hand" is an original comic short, written and illustrated by  Phillip C. Jacobson, inspired by E.A. Poe's, "Never Bet The Devil Your Head". 1 of 13 pieces in The POE TWISTED Anthology, a collection of original stories and art inspired by the Dark Master of American Gothic fiction, Edgar Allan Poe.  Published by Red Stylo Media. Edited by Enrica Jang.

PDF, 16 pages, color.  Includes special features: original character sketches, note from the artist.

name: Absolution, a POE TWISTED Tale
description:
You can't take back the moment that changes your life forever.  A grieving father is driven mad by one of his son's Christmas toys in ABSOLUTION, a sad and haunting graphic tribute to Poe's most famous poem, "The Raven". BONUS content includes a note from the editor and script from writer Jason Ciaramella!

ABSOLUTION is written by Jason Ciaramella (2011 Eisner Award nominee for The Cape one-shot from IDW). Glorious art by intrepid comic's veteran Enrique Savory, Jr. Color and letters by Poe-tributors Alex Cormack (ELDORADO and the upcoming TELL TALE CAT) and Andre Frattino (AZTECA color and letter man)!

14 pages including bonus content, full color, pdf download

name: Macuahuitl (modified Aztec blade, from AZTECA)
description: You've seen the macuahuitl in Red Stylo Media's AZTECA comic series as Nicho's fighting weapon of choice, and on the "The Deadliest Warrior" television show. The original Aztec blades of wood and stone are fabled to have been strong and lethal enough to decapitate a charging horse in a single blow. This modern version is a modified replica of the famed macuahuitl, exactly as it is featured in AZTECA. Quarter inch-thick, polished stainless steel, with cherry grip and blood-wood finish. 37" x 4.5", tapered to 4" at the grip. A gorgeous addition to any weapons collector's show case. We encourage you to Contact Us for more details before purchasing. NOT A TOY. These replicas are for decoration only. Steel is not tempered and blades are not sharpened, thus this piece cannot be used in sparring without risk of injury and/or damage to the blade. Copy of AZTECA #1 with every purchase. Special order option are available. Allow two weeks for delivery.

name: The Jason Strutz LIMITED EDITION POE TWISTED collection
description: Three limited edition posters of original POE TWISTED pieces from artist Jason Strutz: "Unusual Suspect" 12" x 18"; "What Took You So Long?" 12" x 18"; "The Beating of the Hideous Cuteness" 12" x 18" Full color posters.

name: The Dirk Strangely POE TWISTED LIMITED EDITION Collection
description: Set of two triptych prints of artist Dirk Strangely's "Poe Cat" and "Poe Raven". Matted, without frame. 11" x 17" each.

name: The Andrew Jerz LIMITED EDITION POE TWISTED collection
description: Three limited edition posters of original POE TWISTED pieces from artist Andrew Jerz: "Lenore" 12" x 18", "Amonstrillado" 12" x 18", "H.P. Poecraft's Careful Coffins for the Concerned Cataleptic" 24" x 32" Full color
